instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Metallic tool hit to powered-on logic board
threads.message: My mid 2012 Macbook Pro 13" A1278 recently crashed when using a public hotspot. I was poking around the logic board and nicked the soldering for the battery connector with a metallic tool. There is only a faint green led on the power cord when plugged-in. The laptop doesn't power-on either.

threads.title: Metallic tool hit to powered-on logic board
threads.message: Dead SMC for a start..... Could be more damage.....

threads.title: Metallic tool hit to powered-on logic board
threads.message: Bad ISL6259 and U4900. 12v went to the 3v data line of the SMC & ISL6259.

threads.title: Metallic tool hit to powered-on logic board
threads.message: Don't forget the battery indicator is also on this line and is a suspect. But yeah SMC(U4900) and U7000 are the first ones to address, start with just U7000 and see if you get lucky.

threads.title: Metallic tool hit to powered-on logic board
